arez

Class Flags

  • java.lang.Object
    • arez.Flags

  • public final class Flags
extends Object
    Flags that can be passed when creating observers that determine the configuration of the observer. The class also contains constants and methods used to extract runtime state from Observers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int AREZ_DEPENDENCIES
      Flag set set if the application code can not invoke Observer.reportStale() or ComputableValue.reportPossiblyChanged() to indicate dependency has changed and the observer.
      static int AREZ_OR_EXTERNAL_DEPENDENCIES
      Flag set if the application code can invoke Observer.reportStale() or ComputableValue.reportPossiblyChanged() to indicate non-arez dependency has changed.
      static int AREZ_OR_NO_DEPENDENCIES
      Flag set set if the application code can not invoke Observer.reportStale() or ComputableValue.reportPossiblyChanged() to indicate dependency has changed.
      static int ENVIRONMENT_NOT_REQUIRED
      The action or observer need not be wrapped by the Environment if the environment is supplied to the ArezContext.
      static int ENVIRONMENT_REQUIRED
      The action or observer must be wrapped by the Environment if the environment is supplied to the ArezContext.
      static int KEEPALIVE
      The runtime will keep the observer reacting to dependencies until disposed.
      static int NESTED_ACTIONS_ALLOWED
      Indicates that the an action can be created from within the Observers observed function.
      static int NESTED_ACTIONS_DISALLOWED
      Indicates that the an action must not be created from within the Observers observed function.
      static int NO_REPORT_RESULT
      The flag can be passed to actions or observers to force the action to not report result to spy infrastructure.
      static int NO_VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED
      This flag can be passed to skip verification that action was required.
      static int OBSERVE_LOWER_PRIORITY_DEPENDENCIES
      Flag indicating that the Observer is allowed to observe ComputableValue instances with a lower priority.
      static int PRIORITY_HIGH
      High priority.
      static int PRIORITY_HIGHEST
      Highest priority.
      static int PRIORITY_LOW
      Low priority.
      static int PRIORITY_LOWEST
      Lowest priority.
      static int PRIORITY_NORMAL
      Normal priority if no other priority otherwise specified.
      static int READ_ONLY
      The observer can only read arez state.
      static int READ_WRITE
      The observer can read or write arez state.
      static int REQUIRE_NEW_TRANSACTION
      The flag can be passed to actions to force the action to create a new transaction.
      static int RUN_LATER
      The scheduler will not be triggered when the observer is created.
      static int RUN_NOW
      The scheduler will be triggered when the observer is created to immediately invoke the Observer._observe function.
      static int VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED
      The flag can be passed to actions to force the action to verify that an action performed an activity that required an action.

      • NESTED_ACTIONS_DISALLOWED

        public static final int NESTED_ACTIONS_DISALLOWED
        Indicates that the an action must not be created from within the Observers observed function.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AREZ_DEPENDENCIES

        public static final int AREZ_DEPENDENCIES
        Flag set set if the application code can not invoke Observer.reportStale() or ComputableValue.reportPossiblyChanged() to indicate dependency has changed and the observer.
        See Also:
        DepType.AREZ, Constant Field Values

      • AREZ_OR_NO_DEPENDENCIES

        public static final int AREZ_OR_NO_DEPENDENCIES
        Flag set set if the application code can not invoke Observer.reportStale() or ComputableValue.reportPossiblyChanged() to indicate dependency has changed. It is not necessary for the observer to invoke ObservableValue.reportObserved() on any dependency.
        See Also:
        DepType.AREZ_OR_NONE, Constant Field Values

      • AREZ_OR_EXTERNAL_DEPENDENCIES

        public static final int AREZ_OR_EXTERNAL_DEPENDENCIES
        Flag set if the application code can invoke Observer.reportStale() or ComputableValue.reportPossiblyChanged() to indicate non-arez dependency has changed.
        See Also:
        DepType.AREZ_OR_EXTERNAL, Constant Field Values

      • READ_ONLY

        public static final int READ_ONLY
        The observer can only read arez state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • READ_WRITE

        public static final int READ_WRITE
        The observer can read or write arez state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RUN_NOW

        public static final int RUN_NOW
        The scheduler will be triggered when the observer is created to immediately invoke the Observer._observe function. This configuration should not be specified if there is no Observer._observe function supplied. This should not be specified if RUN_LATER is specified.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RUN_LATER

        public static final int RUN_LATER
        The scheduler will not be triggered when the observer is created. The observer either has no Observer._observe function or is responsible for ensuring that ArezContext.triggerScheduler() is invoked at a later time. This should not be specified if RUN_NOW is specified.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEEPALIVE

        public static final int KEEPALIVE
        The runtime will keep the observer reacting to dependencies until disposed. This is the default value for observers that supply a observed function but may be explicitly supplied when creating ComputableValue instances.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRIORITY_HIGHEST

        public static final int PRIORITY_HIGHEST
        Highest priority. This priority should be used when the observer will dispose or release other reactive elements (and thus remove elements from being scheduled).

        Only one of the PRIORITY_* flags should be applied to observer.

        See Also:
        Priority.HIGHEST, Priority.HIGHEST, Constant Field Values

      • PRIORITY_HIGH

        public static final int PRIORITY_HIGH
        High priority. To reduce the chance that downstream elements will react multiple times within a single reaction round, this priority should be used when the observer may trigger many downstream reactions.

        Only one of the PRIORITY_* flags should be applied to observer.

        See Also:
        Priority.HIGH, Priority.HIGH, Constant Field Values

      • PRIORITY_NORMAL

        public static final int PRIORITY_NORMAL
        Normal priority if no other priority otherwise specified.

        Only one of the PRIORITY_* flags should be applied to observer.

        See Also:
        Priority.NORMAL, Priority.NORMAL, Constant Field Values

      • PRIORITY_LOW

        public static final int PRIORITY_LOW
        Low priority. Usually used to schedule observers that reflect state onto non-reactive application components. i.e. Observers that are used to build html views, perform network operations etc. These reactions are often at low priority to avoid recalculation of dependencies (i.e. ComputableValues) triggering this reaction multiple times within a single reaction round.

        Only one of the PRIORITY_* flags should be applied to observer.

        See Also:
        Priority.LOW, Priority.LOW, Constant Field Values

      • PRIORITY_LOWEST

        public static final int PRIORITY_LOWEST
        Lowest priority. Use this priority if the observer is a ComputableValue that may be unobserved when a PRIORITY_LOW observer reacts. This is used to avoid recomputing state that is likely to either be unobserved or recomputed as part of another observers reaction.

        Only one of the PRIORITY_* flags should be applied to observer.

        See Also:
        Priority.LOWEST, Priority.LOWEST, Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_REQUIRED

        public static final int ENVIRONMENT_REQUIRED
        The action or observer must be wrapped by the Environment if the environment is supplied to the ArezContext. This flag is incompatible with ENVIRONMENT_NOT_REQUIRED and the javadocs for ENVIRONMENT_NOT_REQUIRED documents how the default value is derived.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_NOT_REQUIRED

        public static final int ENVIRONMENT_NOT_REQUIRED
        The action or observer need not be wrapped by the Environment if the environment is supplied to the ArezContext.

        This flag must not be present if ENVIRONMENT_REQUIRED is present. If neither ENVIRONMENT_NOT_REQUIRED nor ENVIRONMENT_REQUIRED is specified then ENVIRONMENT_REQUIRED is assumed for observers where the APPLICATION_EXECUTOR is not present, while ENVIRONMENT_NOT_REQUIRED is assumed for actions and other observers.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_REPORT_RESULT

        public static final int NO_REPORT_RESULT
        The flag can be passed to actions or observers to force the action to not report result to spy infrastructure.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REQUIRE_NEW_TRANSACTION

        public static final int REQUIRE_NEW_TRANSACTION
        The flag can be passed to actions to force the action to create a new transaction.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED

        public static final int VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED
        The flag can be passed to actions to force the action to verify that an action performed an activity that required an action. These activities include:
        • read or write an observable property.
        • read a computable property.
        • schedule an observer.
        • mark an observer as stale.
        • report possible change in computable property.

        This flag must not be present if NO_VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED is present. If neither VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED nor NO_VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED is specified then VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED is assumed.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED

        public static final int NO_VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED
        This flag can be passed to skip verification that action was required. This flag must not be present if VERIFY_ACTION_REQUIRED is present.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
